all_reviews.review_title: Excelent prioduct and reliable support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal is a fantastic company that provides a comprehensive push notification platform for businesses and developers. I have had the pleasure of using their services for the past few years, and I have been thoroughly impressed with the quality of their product and the support they offer. The services have grown hugely since we started using it ourselves in 2018.

The platform is incredibly user-friendly and easy to navigate. The dashboard is well-organized, making it easy to manage multiple campaigns and track their performance. OneSignal also offers a wide range of features, including audience segmentation, A/B testing, and automated messaging, which make it easy to create highly targeted and effective campaigns. this is key for our app.

OneSignal's customer support team is top-notch. They are usually always available to answer any questions or concerns I may have, and they consistently go above and beyond to ensure that I am getting the most out of their platform.

OneSignal's pricing is also very reasonable, especially when compared to similar services in the market. The free version of their platform is quite generous, allowing businesses to send Unlimited API messages per month, which is great for small businesses or those just starting. They also offer more advanced plans for larger companies, but the pricing is still very competitive.

Overall, I highly recommend OneSignal for anyone looking for a robust push notification platform with excellent customer support. Their product and team are top-notch, and they have consistently exceeded my expectations.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
OneSignal support team is highly responsive when you get them at the right time, and always provides helpful and actionable advice. But we did have a few queries that lapsed over the weekend and well into the following week. But it wasn't a big deal for us.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Nudging app users back to our service. AUtomating push messaging to keep existing users happy, informing user of new data, new features and what we are doing as app developers.

all_reviews.review_title: Efficient and Reliable Push Notification Service with OneSignal
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
One of the best things about OneSignal is its ease of use and efficiency. It provides a simple and user-friendly dashboard, making it easy to set up and manage push notifications for your website or app.

Another great feature of OneSignal is its reliability. It has a robust infrastructure that ensures push notifications are delivered to users in a timely and consistent manner. OneSignal also provides advanced targeting and segmentation options, allowing you to personalize notifications based on user behavior and preferences.

In addition, OneSignal provides detailed analytics and insights that enable you to track and analyze the performance of your push notifications. This data can help you optimize your notifications to improve engagement and retention.

Overall, OneSignal is a highly effective and reliable push notification service that can help you reach and engage with your audience in a more personalized and efficient manner.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The pricing model of OneSignal's paid plans to be relatively expensive compared to other push notification services in the market. However, it's worth noting that OneSignal offers a range of features and integrations that may justify the cost for some businesses.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal is primarily solving the problem of how to effectively communicate with customers or users across different platforms and devices. With the rise of mobile devices and the increasing amount of time that people spend on their smartphones, push notifications have become a powerful tool for businesses to reach their audience in a timely and personalized way.

we can now interact with them more successfully and smoothly.

These features make it a highly valued tool for improving user engagement and retention.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The marketing automation features are limited and restrictive, as time-based segments are not supported.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us improve user engagement and retention by delivering targeted, real-time messaging to our mobile app users. Some of the problems it solves include:

Improving user engagement: OneSignal makes it easy to reach users with relevant, timely messages, even when they are not actively using the app.

By using OneSignal, we could manage all our marketing push notifications in one place, streamlining communication and reducing the need for manual processes.

OneSignal offers real-time analytics and reporting, which can help understand the impact of the messages.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to connect multiple platforms and use push notifications in your app
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
First of all, I like Onesignal SDK very much. It is so helpful because it allows configuring many frameworks in a short period of time.

Secondly, I'm thankful for the documentation. It is so detailed that I could implement push notifications in some projects without knowing the languages and frameworks they are written on.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I had issues with deep linking in ios. It works when I click on the link in messengers. However, when I click on the push notification with a link, my app opens the bottom sheet with an in-app browser with that link. And I couldn't catch this link in my deep link handler.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal handles user ids and maps them to the push ids. So there is no need to store this data on my side. It reduces the time needed to implement push notifications.

And now, OneSignal is developing email and sms channels to provide a complete user notification solution.

all_reviews.review_content:

OneSignal's simplicity of use is one of its best features. It's an excellent solution for handling push notifications because to its user-friendly design and straightforward setup process. I especially appreciate the personalization choices that let me make my messages unique and focus them on the demographic I'm trying to reach.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
OneSignal does have one drawback, though: for those who are not tech-savvy, it might be intimidating. The platform has many features, but it could take some time to fully explore and comprehend them all.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal has significantly increased our customer engagement and retention rates as an online shop. We can watch user activity and adjust our marketing strategies thanks to its real-time data. We may use OneSignal to provide customized push notifications to our customers informing them of new merchandise, special offers, and other pertinent updates. As a result, our company has seen an increase in visitors and sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to install, even easier to use.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The only thing I can think of, is that it's still pretty hard to fully customize the pop-up asking for notification access for Web notifications. The did recently add an option to change the text, button size/color and logo, but it would have been nice to be able to completely change the lay-out of this pop-up with your own CSS.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a progressive web app developer (who publishes in the appstores using a WebView container), OneSignal is the only solution for cross-platform push notification sending.

all_reviews.review_title: Great to tailor the experience of outbound visitors
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The platform is very dynamic. We've been able to very quickly set up dozens of custom sequences for users coming from different ads. Usually, tailoring message sequences used to take us a while to do, but with Onesignal, we were able to design a few different sequences and duplicate them with a few tweaks to deliver ads audiences more personalized touches

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Nothing glaring comes to mind, but the customer service is pretty poor most of the time. Thankfully we haven't had to resort to them much but they usually took quite a while to get back when we needed them.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our messaging/notification sequences were the same for inbound and outbound audiences which meant that we couldn't get the most out of visitors coming from ads as their experience wasn't tailored to them. Onesignal was great in that regard as we were able to very easily set up new handling sequences with different SMS, emails, and notifications than the ones we use for inbound. After swithcing over, we saw an increase of between 5% - 20% in actions taken by some of our ads audiences which doesn't seem like much but it absolutely launched our ads efforts.

all_reviews.review_title: One notifications console to rule them all!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Like the brand name suggests - this is a single console that allows me to communicate with all the riders using my bicycle marketplace via email, notif, in-app banners etc. To set up transactional notification logic as well as create weekly marketing notifications. I can also A/B test notifs/emails - set up complex Journeys logic combining various types of communication methods for certain systems ( such as onboarding ) and then A/B test those as well!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Some of the UX needs polish and some features such as Journeys A/B testing still need work yet overall still amazing how powerful of a platform it is for how small the team behind it is :)

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Its a fairly easy to implement SDK that allows me to start sending out notifs to all 3 clients Android/ChromeOS, iOS/macOS, Web + email AND allows my dev team to integrate with for transactional notifications that are built into the logic of those same clients.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Plugin, usefull documentation, GREAT support ( from Juan ).
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
For sure, the support: Fast reply, patience, and links to try out to solve the problem. At least the best support ever received, I think. Meaby not the best choice to use chat instead of emails, but understandable. Anyway, I got a problem with the OneSignal SDK setup, but it came out that the problem was not OneSignal but another Plugin that interfaced with OneSignal. Juan helped me find out the problem and gave me a lot of support and solutions; I'm glad he worked with me ( in some way ).
In conclusion, one of the best things I liked is the dashboard; helpful and clear, and every section is straightforward to understand and use. I'll recommend OneSignal to all who need a notification infrastructure and for sure, and I'll surely use it again for future projects. Thanks again for your support, Juan; hoping this review can help others try OneSignal and get in touch with you if an issue arises.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I'm new to OneSignal use, so I didn't find any problems or downsides for now. The website is clear and modern, dashboard and notification system are perfect and fast, so ( for now ) nothing to say.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
As I said, I'm new. But OneSignal solves the remote push notifications infrastructure; they track all the data so you can check it out quickly, and there are emails and SMS infrastructure for the future. So for a business is a good choice if you don't need too much privacy.

In conclusion, one of the best things I liked is the dashboard; helpful and clear, and every section is straightforward to understand and use. Thanks again for your support, Juan; hoping this review can help others try OneSignal and get in touch with you if an issue arises.

all_reviews.review_title: Complaint About OneSignal/iOS-Hardware Interaction Answered With Detailed Workaround
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Speaking only of the product itself, OneSignal excels at its primary function, which is the distribution of messages and images within *our* game system, starting from a relatively easy-to-use Dashboard origin point.  From the programmer's perspective, the software module is not trivial to set up, but the technical team's adherence to the Cocoapods standard does make updating the software less of a hassle.

Regarding the support received, I was deeply satisfied by the company response to our latest problem.  Team member Jon Fishman went to extra effort to provide a near-exact programming sample that we could place into our code, and through it the issue was directly solved.  I've never known of any other company that supplies a customized sample of code as an answer -- the response could not be more perfect.  Furthermore, after Jon's first involvement, he set up recurring check-ins for our help ticket, which reminded us that we had a solution available to try, and saw us to the ultimate confirmation of a successful help session.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
This will be an unfair comment, but very recently -- September 2021 to February 2022 -- the OneSignal module was directly responsible for complete breakage of the iOS copy of our product.  On a positive note, "Danny" from OneSignal company provided faithful support at that time, suggesting that our copy of the software was out-of-date, and we should pull the latest version immediately.  Still, it was a time of great panic for our staff, since the consequence of the obsolete OneSignal code was to crash the app immediately on startup with no explanation offered on-screen or even in the logs we were able to retrieve at the time.

In summary, we found it concerning that a malfunction in the OneSignal module could render the iOS copy of the app completely unusable, while offering no explanation as to what went wrong.
(To be clear, it is the software that didn't explain the crash.  OneSignal staff was very helpful.)

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal provides a platform of sorts to coordinate communication with our customer base; note that when I, the reviewer, James, say "our customers", I'm speaking of the game players of the Walking Dead: Road To Survival, and "our" includes the true owners and publishers of the game, Scopely.  "I" am just a programmer of the game and a member of the contracted development studio, Iugo.

The messages and images that we send via OneSignal are a cornerstone of our marketing strategy.  Each message overlays very simply overtop of our app screen, appears once (or optionally as many times as the trigger conditions dictate), and can be targeted to reliable categories of users.

We have our own proprietary messaging systems that are able to act on triggers managed within the game, and of course OneSignal is not our only partnership that enables advertising.  However, ever since its introduction, OneSignal has been a permanent fixture of our customer communication strategy.

The templates provided are good to go with. Also, the teach team is available when needed and this can  get integrated with other 3 party tools like we use.

It becomes difficult for us if we drill and dive down to a particular push notification or a message that we want to analyze. It also helped us to send push notifications or schedule them for the different campaigns we launched and floated across and the kind of response we received for it. It helped us to reach a much broader section of the society.

all_reviews.review_title: Key service for our company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Targeting options are very valuable for our company, we send push notification to our players (mobile game) and we need to be able to target only specific users. Being able to target users based on the install date is a must.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The paid option wasn't very clear for us at first, we didn't knew how it will improve our experience and our users experiences.
I believe it would be better to give more glimpse of the data reports for example to push company to upgrade their plan.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our game is a real time strategy game of conquest, players can attack each other every time of the day, every day. Players can defend their kingdom in real time but they need to know when they are attacked. that's why we need to be able to quickly send push notification to let them know about the attack. We need to send a lot of push notifications to a lot of people with less delay possible. One signal is capable of doing so and without it our user experience would be definitely worst.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy, reliable, and handles the complexities for us
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Segmentation with One Signal, especially when coupled with tags, is one of the fundamental features I find incredibly helpful. The ability to send notifications based on tags and app versions has helped me in numerous ways as a developer and other people involved in marketing.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The downside of segmentation is that the number of segments is limited, and so is the number of tags per user. The "tags per user" limitation has made it difficult to develop since I have always had to find clever and messy ways to encode information, ultimately making the code a bit messy and the targeting less flexible. This is in a professional plan, where these limitations are less restrictive than other plans, so I imagine this is even harder in lower tiers.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
For us, OneSignal gives a personality to numbers. On our segment tab, we have a rundown of who each user is and related information about their behavior. This helps us connect with them and offer a curated experience through push notifications and other messages. In-app messages are also really nice. We have had the feature "in-app modal" in our backlog ready to begin implementation, but OneSignal handled this with complete functionality, which was very convenient.

all_reviews.review_title: Versatile platform, delivers what it promises, simple usability but powerful features.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The integration part. I have many ways to use the provider. As a developer, I have several resources at my disposal to get the most out of the service.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Delivery reports. In the list of users reached, I only have a view of only 6, and only information that the campaign delivered +90, for example. I don't know if there is any place in the OnSignal Interface, on the website, where I can have this detailed view of the campaign, not just graphics, because if I want to improve reach, I need to have details of each user that the campaign failed to deliver. Knowing how many I managed to reach is important, but not being able to know why I couldn't reach a certain user is even more relevant.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ensure faster communication to users of our App and improve their engagement.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Documentation & Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
We launched Push notifications on our React Native Mobile Apps, using React Native, we were used to limited third-party SDK support but Onesignal proved to be the best here. We could implement all the RN features that the Native SDKs supported. The Docs were very clear and guided us on each step. The SDKs are on Github and have good open source community support.
Brit from the support team has been very helpful with our Email setup, he also reached out to us when our DNS settings were misconfigured and helped us fix them.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Navigating the dashboard can feel a little slow, each navigation does a full page reload. It could be improved with some client-side routing but not a big problem.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Push Notifications, Email Messaging and SMS Messaging Integrations under one hood with excellent SDKs and Documentation.
Time to integrate and go-live was short and within the estimations,

all_reviews.review_title: Incredible Customer Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal, and specifically Brit, took the time to answer multiple rounds of questions via email to help us troubleshoot potential sources for some issues we were having.  After we tried all his suggested solutions, which fixed most but not all our issues he took the time to set up an hour-long video conference so we could share our screens and find the cause together. He then gave us a full explanation of some next steps we could pursue to prevent future problems and better utilize the full capabilities of the OneSignal platfrom.  Oh, and he did all this even though we aren't even paying customers yet - but as we continue to grow our readership and reach with OneSignal we definitely will be!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Only downside so far is the cap of 10,000 notifications, but we have learned how to create segments to better target readers and also will be looking to subscribe as we grow and reach more than 10,000 actives.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal helps us stay connected with our readership throughout the day and re-engage them when we have new stories that fit their specific interests. We see the direct results in the form of real-time traffic to our site.

all_reviews.review_title: A highly cost-effective push notification service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
One signal helped us send your subscribers push notifications very quickly at an excellent rate. It is well documented, so it was really easy to set up tests. Overall we are very happy to use One signal.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The development seems a bit slow for new features. Costs seem to rise highly at higher volumes. Data storage appears to be an issue, and a more interactive dashboard is required.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've had issues sending push notifications, and One signal helped us immensely with this issue; the A/B testing also helped us with the customer segmentation part as well.

all_reviews.review_title: We improve communication with our customers, thanks to OneSignal!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
- I love the user experience. The control panel has a friendly and easy-to-understand interface.

- No need to touch the code on the website. The integration is simple and fast.

- Customer service and retention are much better than we expected.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The page sometimes feels unoptimized and slow to load some sections. However, it is not a problem with our internet connection or our computers.

I also think there should be a simplified control panel, with the option to have only a few functions enabled, like shortcuts.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
As soon as we implemented OneSignal, we started to see an increase in sales, a better reception among our customers and decrease in the workload in the customer service department.

Customer acquisition improved too much for us. It means a better situation for us in every way.

all_reviews.review_title: One Signal: Should you consider it for your Push Notification need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
One Signal is a well-known tool in the space of push notification services. The smooth onboarding and 15-minute setup are best compared to other options. I like the simplicity of the Real-time reporting dashboard, which is clutter free and easy to understand for new users. Other options as A/B Testing, Audience Segmentation and Automated Messaging, are also good.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
One thing I feel is lacking is a feature to remove inactive & duplicate subscribers. This one feature is much needed to keep it clean. Another thing which is demerit is the pricing. Once you scale the pricing would feel at a higher side as compare to the other options in the market.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We used One Signal to push out notifications from our website to visitors. It helped us send notifications about our new posts, offers and updates to our segmented users as per our strategy. The real-time tracking of the delivery of push notifications helped us make better decisions which helped us in increasing our ROI.

all_reviews.review_title: My Honest Review on OneSignal.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
I liked many things about OneSignal
1. It is very easy to send push notifications and also set up in-app messages.
2. It's very flexible and can be accessed on all devices like chrome, firefox. safari, etc.
3. They have one of the best customer support that I've experienced.
4. It also has analytics so you need only one thing a good idea and you can start planning your campaign.
5. I also liked the Amplitude integration.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The things I disliked about OneSignal are:-
1. The Analytics could be better.
2. They don't keep an archive of data for more than 30 days.
3. They also don't allow the export of all of the data which is shown in UI.
4. The analytics could be better.
5. I've also felt lagging and hanging while performing some tasks, so it can be improved.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. We daily send many push notifications to users worldwide without any issues.
2. Helps in customer engagement and communication.
3. Sending real-time notifications of important events to specific users.
4. The push notifications make users more engaged with our app.
5. It's very useful for small-scale and mid-scale segment organizations.

all_reviews.review_title: Great and easy-to-use tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The use is straightforward. However, if anything is unclear, the support team can be reached quickly and offers valuable assistance. We were in contact with Brit in particular. He was always friendly and helped us a lot, even in case of more specific questions. On a positive note, he quickly connected us with other support colleagues or even directly with the OneSignal development department after his knowledge was exhausted.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
We encountered a few bugs during our use, but they were limited to the internal usage of the tool only. Although we communicated bugs in the OneSignal tool in detail to the development department of OneSignal, the problem-solving by OneSignal was, unfortunately, sometimes prolonged.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
The tool allows us to set up targeted messages at any time without the need to involve the development department, which is a significant advantage. Furthermore, many customization options are offered, which was unfortunately not the case with our previously used tool. In addition, the messages are sent with the highest reliability.

Another great point was the customer support, even though some of my demands couldn't be met, the OneSignal representative was really clear and fast to respond.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Segmentation for my base is not intuitive at all, some things even needed to be programmed in the backend of my system. Has some performance issues that can't be fixed (delivery inefficiency) and has little to no metrics to follow. Even with the paid upgrade, the raw data says nothing and the pre-calculated metrics are usually biased and/or wrong.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Communication with my customers in a fast and simple way, which helps me focus on what's important. It also helps to spread crucial messages when needed. Business performance increases by using OneSignal.

all_reviews.review_title: Support is almost always very helpful
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Onesignal helps us offload management of push notification specifics so we don't have to worry about it.

When we get to a technical support member, they are almost always very helpful.
Jenna from their support member was very friendly and patient with some seemingly obvious questions, and helped resolve my issues very quickly.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
In the past, support has just linked to documentation pages that we have already read, and could take several interactions before getting to a more technical support member who can help with a specific issue.
Some of the operations surrounding external user ids seem like they are still in progress. It can be a hassle to find device information based on an external user id, without knowing the individual device ids or other metadata about the user.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Their comprehensive API and visual dashboard make it easy to use onesignal from both automated systems and busniess-oriented users making manual targeting campaigns.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using onesignal to reduce the complexity of our own system, by abstracting any device-specific information from own database, we are able to target users directly without worrying about what devices they are using, if any.

all_reviews.review_title: Endless Marketing Opportunities With OneSignal
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
One of the best features of OneSignal is the ability to segment your audience, determining their segment upon when they sign up for OneSignal.  I really don't know of a competitor that could do it this this way!  Also, the ability to send out images was also cool.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The only issue with OneSignal has been data ownership.  So it depends on whether or not you are marketing or using this for transactional purposes. If only marketing th tracking issues are not that critical.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
You need to understand how it works, not abuse the customers with too many messages that are not expected.  If you work with OneSignals methods, especially the segmentation, the opportunity is endless.  However, like everything that needs to be sophisticated, the tool is great for sending generic messages to several segments. We were successful in going with 100 segments, but we had to use the API. So, it can be amazing, but you need tech support for that.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we used OneSignal to solve is the ability to optin and collect customers for Texting based on their city, or segment. This was a great way to communicate to people about events in their city and not for the overall company.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Partner for Startups!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal allows for a ton of customization. They segment users and have a very user-friendly UI for integrating notifications. The SDK installation is lightweight. The customer service I've received is beyond amazing. They are incredibly responsive and always answer my questions in detail.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The downside of OneSignal is there is a cap for the volume of notifications sent, and for data analysis exports. They don't keep an archive of data for more than 30 days. It's impossible to do year over year or even month over month analysis in their UI for notification performance. They also don't allow an export all of the data that is shown in the UI.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
This is an amazing tool for small to mid-size companies. They have a great solution with tons of awesome features.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending custom notifications. We've been able to integrate and start sending notifications quickly and having them as a partner has been a good experience overall.

all_reviews.review_title: One of Best, Cost Effective and Robust Push Notification Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
There are many.
1. Instant delivery: Send push notifications without any delay or downtime.
2. Provide multiple functionalities to help you decide the best time of delivery, for Eg: intelligent delivery, which sends push automatically at the best time possible.
3. No capping at the enterprise level.
4. Segmentation: There are many options to segment your user base and send push notifications accordingly.
5. Highly cost effective and delivers what's promised.
6. Great support.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
1. Not able to use all the new functionalities without any fees. They could have a freemium model for enterprise users.
2. Features development as per the user's requirements is slow.
3. Should have more features to make the admin user-friendly.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
1. If you want to use a robust push notification service with zero downtime at a cost-effective level, then Onesignal is your friend.
2. There are other services in the market too that you may find cheaper but remember, time is money and not the other way round.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. The major problem we faced was to re-engage our old users.
2. We are ultimately increasing our retention rate, decreasing CAC, and increasing conversion rates by using Onesignal.
3. We are sending many push notifications daily to users worldwide and doing it without facing any issue.

all_reviews.review_title: It's good but can definitely be improved
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The UI & UX aspects of the "New Push Notification" are easy to understand and use. We don't have a specific tool for this feature. It's currently in a good position but c improved on some aspects.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
We should be able to see our scheduled push notifications in "Per users timezone" For example, I scheduled a push, and it will start sending them at 11.45 AM, and it will be delivered at 4.45 PM per users time zone. In the current UI, I can't see the delivery time. It's crucial because when I want to make some changes, I always do it on the delivery time.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Improve your monitoring aspects; it's effortless to schedule a push notification in Onesignal, but monitoring the scheduled push notifications can be improved. You can use a UI like "Google Calendar" to see both delivery time and time of sending.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Push notifications are easy to schedule. UI and UX aspects are easy to understand for the newcomers in our company. Onesignal has improved our retention rates and revenue impacts

all_reviews.review_title: Needs and suggestions for improvement on structures
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Best part is push notification duplicate option in my opinion. Except for companies with very niche needs, I generally consider onesignal to be an adequate service for all companies and/or individuals who want to deliver their push notification and content to users.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
We cannot determine the number of lines we can see on a single page. (In the Push Notifications page)
The lines on the Push Notifications page may be thinner, for now each line is unnecessarily thick.
There is no mobile app, we have to use the browser when we have to handle our tasks on the phone, which is a bad thing.
While installing push, we have to manually enter texts for different languages, we cannot automatically fill in all of our desired languages   by importing an excel file.
While creating a push notification, we cannot see and select colors in the LED Color and Accent Color sections on the android side. Why do we have to learn the color code from outside and come to onesignal page again?
Push notifications calendar only works with 12 hour schedule (am & pm), why there is no 24 hour support in settings?
There is no practical drag-and-drop support for the images we will add to the push notifications page.
After creating the push, we want to go directly to the Messages page, but the system redirects to a new page and shows the details of the push we just created on this page, which causes a waste of time. They can add this as an option in the settings.
The site has only English language support, more options should be added. Shouldn't be difficult to a professional company like OneSignal.
While creating push, we have to scroll down on the page many times in order to do all the settings, the design of the elements here and the weakness in the use of space cause speed loss.
When we click on the "Send To Test Device" button while creating a push, we have to scroll to the right because the pop-up that opens is small. They can remake an enough size of the pop-up so that we can see everything without scrolling.
When sending push, we have to upload the same image repeatedly to both the ios and android parts, there is no setting where we can automatically upload the same image to both.
The service crashes more often than we can accept.
Push notifications that are set forward by selecting the time remain as "scheduled" status recent days. (They wrote that they were working as a team on this issue, but they still didn't implement a solution.)

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Although it has shortcomings, it is a service that you can choose blindly for push notification for now. I believe it will improve over time.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had an app key loss problem related to our application continuously on the google android configure page, onesignal support unit held a meeting with us and dealt with the problem specifically, and resolved the issue with backend support. It is very valuable to get support from a person instead of drowning in F.A.Q pools that do not answer your questions, so I am satisfied with the attention of the engineers working in the user support unit.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about OneSignal?
review_question_answers.answer: Best part is push notification duplicate option in my opinion. Except for companies with very niche needs, I generally consider onesignal to be an adequate service for all companies and/or individuals who want to deliver their push notification and content to users.

When sending push, we have to upload the same image repeatedly to both the ios and android parts, there is no setting where we can automatically upload the same image to both.
The service crashes more often than we can accept.
Push notifications that are set forward by selecting the time remain as "scheduled" status recent days. (They wrote that they were working as a team on this issue, but they still didn't implement a solution.)

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
review_question_answers.answer: Although it has shortcomings, it is a service that you can choose blindly for push notification for now. I believe it will improve over time.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We had an app key loss problem related to our application continuously on the google android configure page, onesignal support unit held a meeting with us and dealt with the problem specifically, and resolved the issue with backend support. It is very valuable to get support from a person instead of drowning in F.A.Q pools that do not answer your questions, so I am satisfied with the attention of the engineers working in the user support unit.

all_reviews.review_title: Great but there are some things to work on
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Clear, intuitive interface, minimalistic nice design.
I am happy to be able to preview messages and duplicate old ones. Insight into recipient statistics and which messages were clicked the most.
Possibility to add emojis and graphics, option to set sending push messages long-term. History of sent messages and the possibility of comparing them and preparing documentation.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Sometimes the page is too slow and I have to take quite a long time for it to load and the number of sort options is sometimes too limited, there could be more options.
Sometimes I find it difficult to locate older messages. and the date system is a bit inconvenient to use (order year-month-day).
These are minor things, but if you fix it, it could make OneSignal even more enjoyable.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
The best application for communicating with customers, great for communicating with the news.
Easy to use, you can learn it very quickly without any problems. Even beginners can handle it. You can add your own graphics and check the statistics of delivered messages even over a longer period of time. The ability to send messages in different languages   of the world.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Increase the interest of recipients. It allows us to find out what people are interested in in our project and what forms of communication are effective. More people became interested in our product and our players are more involved in our game.
If we make any changes to the game, we can easily communicate it to our players.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy and convienient push management

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The number of users displayed on the dashboard shows all users who have ever installed our games (even if they have just opened it once 4 years ago). The in-apps could be improved as well - e.g. the buttons in vertical view could be shortened and put one next to the other, as they take up half the screen.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
I think OneSignal is worth considering if you want to manage your push notifications in a simple and organized manner and receive a great amount of support from the OS team

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are reducing the drop-out rate and increasing retention by sending automated retention notifications. I realized that push notifications have a way of making the users more engaged in our app.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Messaging is the core to most SaaS platforms - and we need it everywhere.  OneSignal helped us simplify our messaging delivery strategies without having to build our own - which allowed our engineers to focus on solving actual customer problems and pains - not rebuild another push notification, email, and sms platform.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The only detractor type statement I can provide is sometimes the Push Notification certification tool does not work as expected, but retrying it often solves the issue.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
For all things communication, if you're building software/SaaS do not waste precious engineering time building - build on top of OneSignal and focus on your client pain points.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Today, we are using OneSignal to send Push Notifications to over 1M customers of the fitness studios on our platform via our Members App.  Evaluating extending our relationship with OneSignal to utilize them for additional communications plumbing needs

all_reviews.review_title: Quick Setup, Easy to Use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
I am using OneSignal for the last three years to send push notifications. I have tried many other services but in the end, I came back to OneSignal. OneSiganl is very easy and quick to set up and very easy to use.
I personally like its "Intelligent Delivery" option for sending push notifications. I saw a higher click rate when I choose this option.
I also like its 'custom segments' option. By this, I can send personalised notifications (I loved this).
The other thing that I like is availability on almost every platform. OneSignal has wide-range support for example many WordPress AMP plugins have the option to integrate it.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I tested many other serviced and expericed that OneSignal's dashboard is slow as compared to the others. The other dislike for its segment limitation. I only can add only two custom segments(Yes it can be upgraded).

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use OneSignal for sending push notifications to my website users. After installation OneSignal's push notification service on my blog, I grab 5-10% subscriber everyday and I can easily retarget them to come back to my blog.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Increasingly the platform is unavailable due to server problems and errors have been a relatively consistent complaint from editorial teams. Particularly in the busier parts of the year this can really throw off plans and significantly reduces our ability to drive immediate traffic to content.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Explore options around custom subscription prompting and data tagging in order to fully utilise the capabilities of the Segmentation tools, which can be a little lacklustre without proper development resource.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Live-Ops designer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Targeting notifications in various languages, intelligent delivery when scheduling messages.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Pretty poor system of checking the clickability and popularity of previously sent messages. I'd like to have more intuitional archives where I could check how popular some notifications were, sort them by popularity or have an efficient search engine when looking for the particular title of the message. Currently, it shows individual instances, often mixed with some automatic notifications so it's difficult to find overall statistics for the push notification I created.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching out to the players who might have forgotten about the app, informing them about new content and sales, creating fun and positive image of the game developer by sending creative messages with lively images and emojis. By doing so we make sure players log in whenever there's a new event in the game to increase the player participation.

all_reviews.review_title: Simply the best push notification service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal is really easy to integrate on our websites and mobile application. It offers beautiful widgets to collect subscribers. We are able to send automated push notifications to our subscribers as soon as some event is triggered. OneSignal is capable of delivering notifications across all major browsers including Safari and Yandex. It can also deliver notifications via Email and SMS making it a most versatile push notification service. It has a free plan to get started and paid plans to take customer engagements to the next level. OneSignal also offers a powerful API allowing us to completely automate the subscription and notification process.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
OneSignal is a software as a service platform, which we cannot host on our own private server making our information less private.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
It's an easy, free, and fast push notification service with powerful APIs and extensive third-party support.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
As OneSignal promptly delivers our content to the targeted list of our subscribers as a push notification on their smartphones and browsers, we don't have to spend time sharing news and offers manually via social media, emails, and ads. With its reliable and automated notifications, now we can focus more on creating great content and spend less time marketing it. OneSignal has helped us to grow our list of subscribers, reach more audiences, and drive more engagements leading to more sales and revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: Push Notifications Made Simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Integrating OneSignal with our app was super simple. And sending push notifications is super simple via the OneSignal dashboard and via the API. I also love the different delivery features they have (immediate, user time zone, intelligent delivery).

I'm also very impressed with their support - I've reached out to them multiple times with questions I've had or issues I've come across, and they always respond very quickly and help me with whatever I need. They've even fixed bugs I've noticed within a matter of days with is amazing (thanks again, Jon!)

Overall a really solid product that has saved us hours of engineering time.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
My only real complaint is their API is still under construction, it seems. Not infrequently, it returns 503 errors and often has maintenance windows that can be hard to deal with. But overall, it's not bad and continues to improve every week.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending push notifications. Benefits: saved hours of engineering time by not having to build out our own notifications system. Great support team to help with any questions or issues.

all_reviews.review_title: Good tools, highly customizable, and kept fairly up-to-date
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
I really enjoy the interface to create campaign ads/modals, as the tools around it are great for product to build their UIs without much needed from engineering

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
As an engineer and consumer of the OneSignal Android SDK, I do feel like some poor decisions make it tougher for me to build the best software I can. An example here is the OneSignal SDK initially letting me provide a custom implemenation for when a notification was received, but that was removed in a major version (I was between a rock and a hard place because I needed that functionality but I had to upgrade).  Otherwise, I've been pleased with the interface and the documentation

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Targeting specific users with campaigns has been useful and takes the burden off engineering to implement/control logic around, so that and push notifications have been very useful

all_reviews.review_title: Great at consolidating push notifications services.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
You can configure your push notification services in one place.

Shannon from their support team quickly assisted us during a loss of service where OneSignal had broken down internally.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The dashboard takes a while to load, and it's hard to make sense of charts, or it doesn't show the information that I'd want to know if I ever have to log in to the admin (are push notifications working? What's the send rate / delivery success %).

We tried to use the OneSignal API to pull data to generate our own charts for reliability, but we send so much volume that without "cursor" support to page through the data, there's just no way to match up the data or get all the data when page 1, 2, 3, 4 are entirely different than a second ago.

The other day, OneSignal just stopped sending push notifications to our iOS customers, completely! The service uptime page claimed everything was fine, but having the service drop out like that is very concerning. We had to contact support to have them fix something on their end.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Great for consolidating push notification logic on your backend when communicating with multiple push notification services. If push notification reliability is critical to your business, make sure to upgrade to the support plan.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Consolidating push notification services for Apple and Android.

Shannon from their support team quickly assisted us during a loss of service where OneSignal had broken down internally.

We tried to use the OneSignal API to pull data to generate our own charts for reliability, but we send so much volume that without "cursor" support to page through the data, there's just no way to match up the data or get all the data when page 1, 2, 3, 4 are entirely different than a second ago.

The other day, OneSignal just stopped sending push notifications to our iOS customers, completely! The service uptime page claimed everything was fine, but having the service drop out like that is very concerning. We had to contact support to have them fix something on their end.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
As an engineer using OneSignal for over four years now, I love how the simplicity has been maintained (improved) while the engineering efforts to deliver new features have continued right along. This makes it an easy "sell" to stakeholders as a reliable tool to use to drive key engagement metrics.

Also, their support is top-notch. They respond quickly, understand the problem, and will work until it's resolved. Recently, Brit has been especially helpful with various questions I've thrown!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
There are some undocumented bugs here and there; however, this isn't a blocker by any means.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an e-commerce company, we need to understand our customers and give them the most customized experience possible. OneSignal makes that easy with their guides tailored to e-com and broad feature set that enables data aggregation, insights, and actionable measures to increase conversions.

all_reviews.review_title: Game changer for our blog
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Our readers are very engaged. One signal provides an incredible way to KEEP them engaged. It's especially great for breaking news when we are trying to beat other outlets to the punch. I like the easy integration with WordPress. I also love that OneSignal makes it easy for us to maintain our list (removing unengaged users and tracking clicks). Additionally, OneSignal makes manually unsubscribing easy for our customers with a widget located directly on our site.Their customer service is also awesome - they fix any issue we have with the service within a couple of hours.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
There's really nothing that I would say I *dislike* about OneSignal. Wouldn't mind if it was just a tad cheaper.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We launched our first blog last year and honestly had no idea what we were doing. One Signal was vital to our ability to get our traffic numbers up in the early months before SEO kicked in and is essential for directing massive hoards of traffic now. And I can't necessarily PROVE this claim - But I swear many of the articles we've pushed using OneSignal have also ended up Google Discover just hours later. Probably unrelated BUT it's enough of a coincidence to have me sending "pushes" every day.

all_reviews.review_title: Proper data processing policy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
I was impressed by the effectiveness of the user's consent management.
You can use the SDK in a non-invasive way by waiting for user consent before even loading, and it makes it equally easy to suspend data processing and delete user data.
The API documentation is precise and immediate.
Great to have a dynamic preview of the messages as the users will display them on different platforms. Same for the reminder of which features (e.g., big image or no image at all) you can leverage depending on the medium.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I would much appreciate first-party support for SMS and an easier Notify Button customization/localization.
In order to be even better, the API documentation could use some inline examples, or a link to an example for each feature.
A great added value would be being able to filter tags in a more sophisticated way. If the developer could write a custom function evaluating the value of tags, they would have the maximum control over their audience, in a much more concise and less error-prone way than though a DLC expressing AND and OR clauses.
I often alias development servers on localhost with ".local" domain names. It would be nice to be able to enable HTTP for testing on such aliases.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Web Push is intuitive both to integrate and to manage

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm implementing a ProgressiveWab App in the Hospitality sector.
I appreciate being able to implement Web Push interactions without recurring to Firebase.

It's pleasing to know that I can see the results of the delivery reports of my messages in real-time. This alone is the most crucial aspect of Onesignal push notifications.

It doesn't work with a lot of site bulders.

You can start with the free tier to see if it fits your needs.

all_reviews.review_title: PM, 12+ years exp, mobile: compared to all other vendors, One Signal support is simply best in class
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The responsiveness is the best in class. I have 12 + years of experience working with mobile app vendors as a product manager, and the experience with One signal support is superior to the rest, and it's not even close... and specifically, I must mention, Jon Fishman and his team, who deserves a huge shout out for being there and helping my team and unblocking us, or teaching us about new features. 15 minutes on the phone with Jon has saved me days, even weeks of work with my development and design team, or when planning and executing your mobile app communication strategy.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Wish I had known about One signal sooner, could have saved me so much pain when compared to Braze or App boy, or Mixpanel for push notifications. Seems that Mixpanel learned that they are inferior in that area compared to One Signal, and they discontinued their push notification feature and made APIs easier with One Signal. I'm glad because now I can use One Signal with Mixpanel together!

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
How to best boost the engagement and product value to my users on mobile using push notifications, ab multivariate testing, in-app messages, and automation via app  events,

Easy to set up and integrate with website. Allows for various segments targeting and customized notification delivery for different recipients.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?

all_reviews.review_title: Highly Recommended.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The SDK was easy to implement, and the web tool is easy to use. Most importantly, their support team is prompt and helpful. We had encountered an in-app messaging issue while testing for our new release. After providing Jon and his team with a test build, they were able to identify the issue and get out an SDK update within a matter of days. The turnaround time and constant updates were much apprecated, and we're very happy to have a solution to the problem.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Ultimately need more advanced support for in-app messaging. CSS support and horizontal previews would be ideal. Triggers are also limited to single values, whereas having a list of values would offer us more control.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're using OneSignal to engage with our player base through in-app messaging and push notifications.

all_reviews.review_title: The best push notification service out there!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
* Push notifications are easy to configure and schedule across all channels, such as mobile, web, email, and SMS
* Able to segment your target audience by location, activity, engagement, etc.
* Very easy to install, set up, and get started - even for beginners
* Powerful analytics enables you to track push notification performance
* Has an API that enables convenient integration with other platforms and services
* Has detailed product documentation with guides and best practices to get you started
* Has a free version and paid versions are affordable

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
* The only thing that I wish could be improved is that the mobile app could be improved with additional features to improve mobility and user experience. Other than that, I have no complaints!

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
I would recommend giving the free version a try!

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main business problem that OneSignal helped us solve is tapping into our audience and developing user engagement with a cost-effective and powerful push notification solution. It helped us increase our web traffic, improve communication, and build loyalty. Overall, I am really happy with what OneSignal has to offer and I am looking forward to seeing how it grows in the future!

all_reviews.review_title: Increase traffic and get your content in front of your audience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal offers an easy-to-use interface that allows powerful increases in driving traffic and engagement.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
For our purposes, as we don't have an app, we're only able to target push notifications to desktop users.

I suppose one other issue that is (very mildly) inconvenient is the integration of tracking. I add in UTMs every time I send a push notification. I know Campaign Monitor, for example, just integrated automatic tracking, so UTMs are automatically applied. This is a tiny issue though, I'm really digging here!

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
(1) We're able to drive traffic to content for a variety of reasons through the segmentation options (geotarget appropriate immigration guides, encourage new subscribers to register for accounts). We have trouble getting our content in front of the right audience--this helps address that problem.

(2) We publish immigration news and important updates: OneSignal allows us to get the news out to as many people as possible, as quickly as possible. This is incredibly important when dealing with time-sensitive information (for example, border closures during the COVID-19 pandemic).

all_reviews.review_title: One Signal, a successful choice for my company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Designed from the ground up to be nothing more than a secure messaging platform.
It is not embedded in an existing platform.
Fully open source.
Familiar and very intuitive interface.
It allows to keep chats in audio, with verification.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
It tends to hang, especially on iOS.
The user interface and some of your user experience may have some, let's say, interesting glitches. However, none of them affect security.
It is not widely used or known.
It needs your phone number to find contacts.
Anyone who is investigating your movements on the Internet will find out that you use Signal. Either way, it won't be able to read your messages.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
It is a communication tool that will help to obtain the best return on marketing investments.
By having the company's application installed, the user agrees to receive this type of notifications that stand out for their customization to increase investments and interaction with customers.
This new means of communication is the new trend for companies to increase their visits and sales.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal is a platform that allows us to send Push Notifications through different platforms that are duly registered in our application. ... First, we need the App Id and the REST API key of our application, which can be found in the Keys & ID's section in App Settings.
We use this application mainly to attract new customers and publicize our services and products.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy & efficient tool for desktop notifications
all_reviews.review_content:

Timely notifications to readers. We used OneSignal to alert subscribers every time we had a new blog post. We also used it frequently during the beginning stages of the COVID-19 pandemic. This was extremely useful to share important information regarding event cancellations, event updates, COVID-19 updates. Once most live events had been canceled, we started using OneSignal as a way to broadcast our content about online/virtual events. This was incredibly important as well given the events industry was hit hard.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I did not run into any issues with OneSignal while using it for desktop notifications. We did not use OneSignal for mobile notifications, so I cannot speak to that either.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Pushing traffic to landing pages with high conversion rates.
Pushing traffic to landing pages with lower conversion rates after implementing optimizations.

all_reviews.review_title: A much needed tool in the digital world
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Best of all is the simplicity of using its interface. You can implement everything in less than 5 minutes and start sending push notifications.
It is also possible to integrate with third party APPs such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics...etc.

It also allows geolocation and geofencing, something very useful for local businesses.

The segmentation that it allows, can make you send notifications to people who have spent more than 15 days without visiting your website, even to people who have bought on your website.

It is also possible to send messages in different languages, something ideal for businesses with a presence in different countries.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
They could add new platforms like WhatsApp or Telegram and even send SMS.
However, they are being updated every few years, so I imagine they will implement these as well.

They should also allow the possibility of creating customized panels for different teams, as well as being able to send Gifs and/or videos.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Implement it as soon as possible. It is the best product in relation to quality/price to reach potential customers in a massive way and with few resources.  It also allows you to segment your users and integrate it with third party APPs.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to impact massively on a large number of users at a low cost, which would otherwise have been a great expense.

We have been able to implement OneSignal, not only on the Web and our Community of users, but also in our Android and iOS APP, which makes us have a much more fluid communication with all our users and not repeat the notifications causing users to unsubscribe.

all_reviews.review_title: OneSignal is the Best !!!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
For me OneSignal is more than just a Notification sending platform.
I use onesignal to keep track of my users through Tags and it works like an Analytics Service.

The most useful highlight feature of OneSignal is it's FREE plan. The current free plan is more than enough for most of the small developers.

The latest In-app Notification feature is a blast and i have increased user activity with this.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I have been using OneSignal for the last 5 years and it was a free service all this while and recently OneSignal introduced PAID plans which added limitations to the Free Plan. But, i understand they got costs to cover. If onesignal could bring more cheap plans with additional benefits to the free plan, small developers like me would happily join them.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
You don't need to think twice, Hands down OneSignal is the Best in it's kind.
If you are a small developer/company looking to start, OneSignal's Free plan is the best option for you.
From my personal experience so far i haven't found any alternative for OneSignal.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
OneSignal's reporting system solves the Firebase messy reports.

And primarily OneSingal API is very simple and very effective.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Through OneSignal our website receives additional traffic and binds readers to us. About a month ago. It was super easy and uncomplicated. We were able to integrate OneSignal directly via plugin into our Wordpress website and have never had any problems since.I can only recommend it. We have also received positive feedback from some of our regular readers, as they now never miss any news from us.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I really can't say anything bad about OneSignal. We have been searching for a long time for such a solution and found only very expensive alternatives on the Internet. OneSignal is even completely free for up to 30000 subscribers.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Just give it a try. It just does what it's supposed to. We have been using OneSignal for some time now and have been able to increase our reader retention and traffic. Up to 30000 subscribers it is also completely free of charge. I can only recommend OneSignal.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
Through OneSignal, we very clearly increase our reader loyalty. Our readers now receive a direct notification when a new article is published. This increases our reader loyalty and our readers are happy because they are always up to date. It is a classic win-win situation for both sides. We are confident that OneSignal can increase our traffic permanently and see no reason not to use the product. I can recommend OneSignal to any website operator. The implementation is very easy and usually takes only a few minutes of work. This little work is worth it in any case.

all_reviews.review_title: Hassle free experience!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
Super easy to plug into any platform. I've been using OneSignal for almost 4 years now, it has never failed in delivering notifications. Also, it's unreal how the platform is free and yet provides almost all the functionalities that you need. We have about 1Mil subscriptions in OneSignal, haven't had any hiccup in notifications. Their support team is very prompt, helpful, and responsive and get things rolling in no time. Highly recommended!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
Nothing specific. The only thing I dislike is navigating around the platform itself. I sometimes find it difficult to find the list of subscribed users. If only there was a handy shortcut to search for users using their iOS/Android players, it would have been great!
Else, the platform works like a charm for our notification needs.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
No second thoughts. If you know a bit about coding, you'll easily be able to implement the service in your solution. A day or two of integration is all you need, we haven't changed the implementation code in a long time apart from updating the SDKs.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We deliver event notifications to our customers using OneSignal. As our majority of customers use iOS & Android devices, OneSignal helps in notifying them of any important event or updates right on their mobile devices. We also use OneSignal to notify our users on their Chrome browsers - works amazing!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
My users can send push notifications without my permission, using my account. It's a security issue and I've shared it with OneSignal support but they think it's not an issue.  AppId and UserId is publicly available in browser console and everyone can get it. In api there is no secretToken check when sending notification using appId and userId.

I use OneSignal as a notification micro service for my game. Main benefit is that we saved developer hours by not re-implementing same functionality

all_reviews.review_title: Simple and effective
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
OneSignal is a very powerful tool. And the best part is that it is pretty simple to use and very effective! I use it for my website, which is bilingual (Portuguese and English). Whenever users subscribe to OneSignal I can easily segment them and, after, I can send customized push messages to them. So, when I have updates for people who only speak Portuguese, I send a message just for them. Updates in English are sent to all others. Whenever a have an update which is "universal", I can send only one push message to all the contacts and write this message in both languages, sharing the same link. The schedule works great and there's an optimize delivery in which OneSignal delivers the messages at a time considered to be the best for each user. I find this very useful, once my subscribers are from different parts of the world, so OneSignal takes care of the delivery for me with this optimization. Another thing which I find absolutely great is that on the side of the screen (Desktop) there are always some help topics describing what we can do and how. For further reading, there's a link with the documentation and everything is very well explained. I created my badge following these materials and it works perfectly!

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
For my needs, there's nothing I disliked.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
OneSignal is straight to the point. If you need a service for delivering push messages, whether you use an app or a website (my case), it gets the job done perfectly. There are tons of customization and segmentation options and the interface and documentation are great!

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
My site is bilingual. Using OneSignal I can segment my users by their location, so whenever I send my messages I can filter them and deliver the best experience. They have an optimized delivery which I find very interesting. The message is delivered when the user is more apt to read it. It's great!

all_reviews.review_title: An excellent free product for web push notifications
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
I used OneSignal for a progressive web app. I liked that it was easy to set up and test for multiple browsers. Our product backlog includes automated push notifications - and I'm sure we could do this using a web hook - but for now the notifications have to be created manually.

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
I wish I could easily measure the push notification opt-in rate through OneSignal instead of triangulating between OneSignal (for install base) and Google Analytics (for eligible population on supported browsers).

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
Go the extra mile in terms of custom UI. Users are too desensitized to the generic insta-prompt and even the branded slide prompt. Like with any consent, show the user value first before asking them to opt in to push notifications.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
We noticed high engagement but low opt-in rates. As a result, we created a custom UI for opt-in instead of the generic slide prompt. This has boosted opt-in rates. Overall, OneSignal helps us engage with our audience to get our content in front of them.

all_reviews.review_title: Free & Easy To Use Push Notification Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about OneSignal?
The best thing I like about OneSignal is it's completely FREE! At the moment I have around 20.000 subscribers on all of my websites. Moreover, OneSignal is easy to install (just download the plugin and install on my Wordpress websites). The interface is user-friendly, I did not got any issues when configure the plugin. Some more OneSignal features I like: Delivery Schedule, Subscribers Segment, Delivery & Conversion Statistics,...

What do you dislike about OneSignal?
The thing that I'm not most satisfied with OneSignal is the Wordpress plugin. For example when I need to push notification of our posts to subscribers, but before doing that, I want to customize the message content and title, and the plugin did not give me an option to do that.

The conversion rate of our messages is also not too good if compare with another services.

Recommendations to others considering OneSignal:
In my opinion, OneSignal is useful for people who have websites and do not want complicated setups to send push notifications. It took just some minutes to get everything set up and running. Another important thing is that it's completely free, really suitable for small business and websites.

What problems is OneSignal solving and how is that benefiting you?
After searching for some push notification services, I tried with OneSignal, although it has a few drawbacks, but it's free and still meets my needs, so I still use it for all of my websites at the moment. It is very useful when used to grab the attention of your website's customers into your new blog posts or products or services. It also help me to save a lot of time, because create and schedule a campaign is very simple and quick.
